item.description:
NEW STUFF:

So the movie's playing at 7 and 8. Let's head to the 7:00 one, which means we'll meet at 6:30 inside the theater doors. (We're going to the 7 show and not the 8 show bc it's a loooong movie.)

Exact change ($8.50) makes me like you more. Be sure to change your RSVP if your decision to attend changes.

We'll head out to Fridays after for a drink or a nibble if anyone's still awake. ;-)

See you tonight!

--Dana




OLD STUFF:
Hey, all.

After a desolate February, let's get back into the movie-watching mayhem with Watchmen. It's sci-fi meets comic books, I think. It does run 163 minutes, so be aware of that.

Summary:
In an alternate 1985 America, costumed superheroes are part of the fabric of everyday society, and the "Doomsday Clock" - which charts the USA's tension with the Soviet Union - is permanently set at five minutes to midnight. When one of his former colleagues is murdered, the washed-up but no less determined masked vigilante Rorschach sets out to uncover a plot to kill and discredit all past and present superheroes. As he reconnects with his former crime-fighting legion - a ragtag group of retired superheroes, only one of whom has true powers - Rorschach glimpses a wide-ranging and disturbing conspiracy with links to their shared past and catastrophic consequences for the future. Their mission is to watch over humanity...but who is watching the watchmen?

Let's plan on the 7:00 or 8:00ish show. I'll update a few days before with exact times.

As always, guests are welcome. Just be sure to include them in your RSVP so that I know how many to expect.

And we'll head to Friday's after the movie, if anyone's game for that.

Please call me with any last-minute RSVPs (after 5:00 on the 11th) or directions if you get lost. 508-308-4897.

See you soon!

--Dana
item.name: Watchmen
